title: Smoked Za'atar Lamb Breast
steps: Trim most fat from the lamb breast. Flip to the bone side and make shallow cuts through silver skin between bones to prevent curling.
Combine sumac, oregano, coriander, cumin, allspice, and salt in a bowl.
Coat lamb with olive oil and apply seasoning mix evenly on all sides.
Place lamb meat-side up and smoke for 1 hour.
Flip lamb and smoke for 45 minutes. Spritz with apple cider.
Return lamb meat-side up and smoke for 45 minutes. Spritz with apple cider every 30 minutes.
Wrap lamb in heavy-duty foil and smoke for 30 more minutes.
Rest at least 10 minutes before slicing.
Top with sesame seeds and lemon juice before serving.
notes: Volume conversions: 2 tsp sumac ≈ 6g, 1 tsp oregano ≈ 3g, ½ tsp spices ≈ 2g each, 1½ tsp salt ≈ 7g, ¼ tsp sesame seeds ≈ 2g
Serve with couscous or tabbouleh for complementary sides
This cut is very fatty and forgiving - difficult to overcook
